text: the robots are coming and the future
will be cleaner this is Damon darlin
with the New York Times you've probably
heard of AI robots Roomba vacuum cleaner
it uses sensors and artificial
intelligence to seek and destroy
anything littering your floors I bought
the first generation Roomba ten years
ago but it didn't clean very well the
new Roomba 880 is redemptive here's a
quick test the first Roomba I owned
couldn't suck up things like catio
heavier debris like pine needles and
dirt clods this one everything okay
it missed a spot but eventually it
circles back the algorithm that controls
the 8080 can appear unpredictable
bordering on haphazard and on occasion
the robot gets momentarily stuck but the
880 cleans as well if not better than an
upright its no dust buster on wheels
like previous models the 8080 is
intelligent enough to avoid a disastrous
tumble down stairs where the 880 really
shines is on mixed floors ever gotten
your upright stuck on the tassels of a
rug most vacuum cleaners would grab them
the Roomba does not the 880's rollers
don't even get tangled in hair or string
you can schedule the Roomba convenient
and nice for surprising cats and then of
my cats were driving but there's enough
of that on YouTube anyway
when its duties done it returns for a
recharge emptying the tray is well dirt
simple in my experience the hall
decreased daily so I could tell the
Roomba was cleaning and it was giving me
a lot more free time
bottom line $700 seems steep twice wood
even a dyson upright cost but if the 880
is a symbol of the automated life to
come then I say bring on the robots it
made my life a lot easier
